resources.string: This field does not need to be left blank anc correctly

Underweight is a condition where an individual has less body weight than is considered healthy in comparison to their height, age, and body structure. Underweight can be caused by various factors, such as inadequate nutrient intake, metabolic issues, or illnesse

Normal Weight (Male) When a male individual\'s Body Mass Index (BMI) falls within the range of 18.5 to 24.9, it is classified as "Normal weight." This classification indicates that the person\'s weight is considered to be within a healthy range for their height. Maintaining a normal weight is associated with several health benefits and a lower risk of various diseases.

Normal Weight (Female) When a female individual\'s Body Mass Index (BMI) falls within the range of 18.5 to 24.9, it is classified as "Normal weight." This classification indicates that the person\'s weight is considered to be within a healthy range for their height. Maintaining a normal weight is associated with several health benefits and a lower risk of various diseases.
This term is used to describe a condition where an individual has more body weight than is considered healthy in comparison to their height, age, and body structure. It is a precursor to obesity.

Obesity is a condition characterized by an excessive amount of body fat, which can have negative impacts on health. Obesity is often classified based on the Body Mass Index (BMI), calculated as the ratio of weight to height.
